docs.lead_paragraph: A 67-year-old retired university teacher is seven months pregnant with twin girls after almost a decade of treatment in fertility clinics, Realitatea TV reported. The woman, Adriana Iliescu, told the television channel that she had ''never been able to accept the idea that I would not have children'' and described her pregnancy as ''the happiest time of my life.''

headline.main: World Briefing | Europe: Romania: Mother-To-Be At 67

docs.abstract: Romanian television reports that 67-year-old retired university teacher is seven months pregnant with twin girls after almost decade of treatment in fertility clinics (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: A Brooklyn company is recalling 102 pounds of sliced smoked Nova salmon due to listeria-monocytogene contamination. The company, Acme Smoked Fish Corporation, said the problem was discovered after routine sampling by the state's Department of Agriculture and Markets. Listeria-monocytogenes can cause serious complications in pregnancy and be harmful to people with weakened immune systems. The salmon, packaged in an eight-ounce plastic container with a sell-by date of Dec. 24, should be returned to its place of purchase or discarded.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: A Dec. 28 letter writer (''Democrats, Rethinking Abortion'') allows a woman only two choices concerning an unwanted pregnancy: ''choosing between aborting a pregnancy and raising an unwanted child.''
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    A Dec. 28 letter writer (''Democrats, Rethinking Abortion'') allows a woman only two choices concerning an unwanted pregnancy: ''choosing between aborting a pregnancy and raising an unwanted child.''

docs.lead_paragraph: The woman accused of killing an expectant mother and cutting the baby from her womb made her initial appearance before a federal judge in Kansas City. The woman, Lisa M. Montgomery, 36, of Melvern, Kan., is charged with kidnapping resulting in death. The hearing lasted less than 10 minutes. Ms. Montgomery answered a series of questions about whether she qualified financially for a public defender, and the judge, John T. Maughmer, said it appeared she would. She is scheduled to return to court tomorrow for a detention hearing. Prosecutors have already asked that she be denied bail.

headline.main: National Briefing | Midwest: Missouri: Hearing In Killing Of Expectant Mother
